meanings.definition: To fasten or secure with laces.
meanings.sent1: She will belace her shoes before going for a walk.
meanings.sent2: I always belace my backpack to keep it closed.
meanings.sent3: The knight needed to belace his armor tightly before the battle.
meanings.sent4: The spider belaced its prey with silk before consuming it.
meanings.sent5: The gardener carefully belaced the vines to the trellis for support.

meanings.definition: To adorn or decorate with laces.
meanings.sent1: The bride decided to belace her wedding dress with delicate lace.
meanings.sent2: She loves to belace her curtains with colorful ribbons.
meanings.sent3: The chef wanted to belace the cake with intricate sugar designs.
meanings.sent4: The artist belaced the painting with gold leaf for a luxurious touch.
meanings.sent5: The tailor will belace the gown with beautiful lace trim for the fashion show.

meanings.definition: To tighten or adjust laces on clothing or shoes.
meanings.sent1: He had to belace his sneakers to make them fit better.
meanings.sent2: She will belace her corset to achieve the desired shape.
meanings.sent3: The athlete needed to belace his cleats for a comfortable fit.
meanings.sent4: The dancer quickly belaced her ballet shoes before the performance.
meanings.sent5: The hiker had to belace his boots tightly for the long trek ahead.
